context.p: When installing the HP Helion OpenStack Carrier Grade software on new hardware, it is recommended that you install the latest available patches on controller-0 before running the region_config script, and before installing the software on other hosts. This ensures that:

li.p: The software on controller-0, and all other hosts, is up to date when the cluster comes alive.
You reduce installation time by avoiding patching the system right after an out-of-date software installation is complete.

context.p: This exercise assumes that the patches to install are available on a USB flash drive, or from a server reachable by controller-0.

info.p: Use the HP Helion OpenStack Carrier Grade bootable ISO image to initialize controller-0.

stepresult.p: This step takes you to the point where you use the console port to log in to controller-0 as user wrsroot.

step.cmd: Copy the patches to the local file system.

info.p: If the patches are on a USB flash drive, copy them from the appropriate mount point to some directory in the local file system. For example:
If the patches are available from a remote server, you need to manually initialize a suitable Ethernet interface first, and then transfer them to the local file system. For example:

stepresult.p: All patches are now in the directory /tmp/patches.

info.p: Upload the patches using the command wrs-patch upload or wrs-patch upload-dir as described in .
Apply the patches using the command wrs-patch apply --all.

stepresult.p: The patches are now in the software updates repository, ready to be installed.

codeblock.systemoutput: Patch installation is complete. Please reboot before continuing with configuration.

stepresult.p: This command installs all applied patches on controller-0.

info.p: You must reboot the controller to ensure that it is running with the software fully patched.

step.cmd: Continue with the HP Helion OpenStack Carrier Grade software installation.

info.p: Log in again as wrsroot and continue with the software installation by running the region_config script. See Installing HP Helion OpenStack Carrier Grade for further details and directions.

result.p: Once all hosts in the cluster are initialized, they are all running fully patched software. The HP Helion OpenStack Carrier Grade cluster is up to date.
